<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
IPO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/29/palantir-debut-nyse-know-surveillance-company?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The One IPO to Rule Them All
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Palantir exterior" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MzYvcGFsYW50aXJfZXh0ZXJpb3IuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Cory Doctorow / Flickr</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The eye of Sauron will turn toward Lower Manhattan today as Palantir <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/what-palantir-does-direct-listing-202144724.html?guccounter=1&guce_referrer=aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZ29vZ2xlLmNvbS8&guce_referrer_sig=AQAAAGdklgUr1xGVrQfvZsX1mKwFl265rxp6zGbkCkdO8oR6AeI8Um8uuGWBG-DbOA9IErTJgHolb8-xkz3yV_QN4Uo74CkTSGr0fvnPBLizKc818MrMRqKehWVBdnSIY6OyfWIpFvDRMvPFZMPJAiJwHhPf7po545u-dbmapXo8XkA8&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">goes public</a> on the NYSE. It’s expected to be valued at around $22 billion, the WSJ reported last week.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s Palantir?</strong> Either a software company that works with government agencies or a defense contractor in Allbirds, depending on how you look at it. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Palantir guzzles up surveillance data on things like troop movements, IED attacks, and Covid-19 cases and presents it to users in a super-slick interface. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Those users are almost all government employees at agencies such as the NSA, the CIA, and the Department of Health and Human Services. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Cofounder and CEO Alex Karp says he’s not like other tech founders—he’s <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/08/20/palantir-denver-hq-ipo-direct-listing/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">been critical</a> of what he calls a liberal “monoculture” in Silicon Valley...so he left. Palantir moved from Palo Alto to Denver last month. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The bull case: </strong>Palantir found its spot in the government contract biz by way of a marketing strategy that is no less creative for the feathers it ruffled: offering free services to soldiers, then letting word travel up the chain of command. It keeps those contracts flowing with close ties to the Trump administration via cofounder and famed venture capitalist Peter Thiel.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The bear case: </strong>Palantir is 17 years old and still isn’t profitable. Plus, it’s reportedly <a href="https://nymag.com/intelligencer/2020/09/inside-palantir-technologies-peter-thiel-alex-karp.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">losing favor</a> in the intelligence and national security communities, and its plans to branch out into police and private-sector partnerships have mostly flopped. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">We may be in for some chaos </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Both Palantir and workplace management tool Asana are <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/palantirs-and-asanas-dueling-ipos-to-test-direct-listing-process-nyse-11601402163?mod=hp_lead_pos4&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">listing directly</a> on the NYSE today, meaning they won’t actually raise money from going public. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Because they cut out investment banks’ underwriting fees, direct listings are an increasingly popular method. Spotify hit the markets via direct listing back in 2018, and Slack did the same last year. The option has its benefits, but can cause volatility since it takes a while to settle on a price.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
2020
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/30/first-president-debate-devolves-shouting-match-amid-president-trumps-interruptions?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Tuesday Night SmackDown: POTUS Edition
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="CLEVELAND, OHIO - SEPTEMBER 29:  U.S. President Donald Trump speaks duri..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNTU5L2RvbmFsZF90cnVtcF9hbmRfam9lX2JpZGUuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Pool/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last night, President Trump and former VP Joe Biden squared off in the <a href="https://apps.npr.org/liveblogs/20200929-debate/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first presidential debate</a>, a pared-down event with a mini audience, no handshakes, and countless interruptions from the president. It was chaotic. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What they said (about business)</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Covid-19: </strong>Trump claimed the U.S. is “weeks away from a vaccine” and pharma companies could move faster, but politics are slowing things down. Biden accused Trump of going against the scientists in his administration who have laid out a longer timeline. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Recovery: </strong>“You can’t fix the economy until you fix the Covid crisis,” Biden said, adding that Trump is not taking appropriate measures to stop the outbreak. Biden also expressed concerns about a “K-shaped” recovery in which top earners recover while working-class families are left behind.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Taxes: </strong>Under Biden’s <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/09/joe-biden-releases-first-part-economic-agenda?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">economic plan</a>, Trump argued higher corporate taxes would push businesses to leave the country, causing “a depression of the likes you’ve never seen.”</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>On personal taxes...following the bombshell </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/27/nyt-releases-explosive-report-president-trumps-tax-history?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NYT report</a></span><span> on Trump’s tax returns, Biden and his running mate Kamala Harris </span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/09/29/918281941/biden-harris-release-2019-tax-returns-hours-before-the-first-debate?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">released their 2019 tax returns</a></span><span> hours before the debate. Biden and his wife, Jill, paid close to $300,000 in federal taxes on $945,000 in taxable income last year. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The big non-business</strong> <strong style="color:#000">news: </strong>Trump refused to categorically denounce white supremacy when asked to by moderator Chris Wallace.</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORKFORCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/29/disney-lay-off-28000-employees?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Disney Serves <em>Up</em> Opening Sequence Vibes
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Disney castle" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84MzIvZGlzbmV5X2Nhc3RsZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Disney said it’s <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/29/disney-to-layoff-28000-employees-as-coronavirus-slams-theme-park-business.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">laying off 28,000 workers</a> across the parks, experiences, and products division, according to a letter circulated by the company’s head of parks to employees. Just over two-thirds of those layoffs will affect part-time workers. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">You probably don’t need three guesses why. </strong>The Covid-19 pandemic has turned Disneyland in Anaheim into the saddest place on Earth. Last week, execs pleaded with the state of California to reopen the park, which has been shut since March.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Many of Disney’s other parks, including Walt Disney World in Florida and locations in Hong Kong, Paris, Tokyo, and Shanghai, </span><span><a href="https://www.cnet.com/health/when-disneyland-disney-world-might-reopen-following-covid-19-closures/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">have reopened</a></span><span>. But reduced crowds and extra health precautions have dented profitability. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Disney’s trying to stop the bleeding. The parks, experiences, and products division accounted for 37% of the company’s total sales in 2019, but the pandemic dropped the segment’s revenue 85% annually last quarter. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">

</a><span>  </span>

</a>
</td>

</table>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY MASTERWORKS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A New Way to Profit in the $64B/Year Art Market
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here’s the thing: The average multi-millionaire doesn’t just put their money in stocks…they invest in valuable assets, like art.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Need proof? There’s a whopping <strong style="color:#000">$1.7 trillion in art</strong> held by the ultra-wealthy—and analysts are predicting that the art market will break out, big time. In fact, blue-chip art has outperformed the S&P by 180% from 2000–2018, according to data.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You don’t have to be a hedge fund guru to see the opportunity here. It’s <em>enormous</em>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So it’s no secret that many consider art to be one of the most lucrative and safe investments (especially now). But the truth is, big-time investments require big-time checkbooks—<a href="https://www.masterworks.io/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=primary&utm_campaign=newsletter_9-30-20&utm_term=Morning%20Brew%20Subscribers&utm_content=newsletter" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Masterworks</a> says otherwise. Featured in NYT, CNN, and Forbes, they’ve made investing in all-star caliber artists like Banksy and Kaws possible (and potentially profitable).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sound awesome? 80k investors think it does.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sign up 100% risk-free today and <a href="https://www.masterworks.io/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=primary&utm_campaign=newsletter_9-30-20&utm_term=Morning%20Brew%20Subscribers&utm_content=newsletter" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">skip the waitlist</a>.</p>
</td>

<!--[if !mso ]><! -- -->
<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LEGAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/29/jpmorgan-pay-record-920m-spoofing-scheme?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
JPMorgan Spoofs Investors
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="JPMorgan" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MDYvamFtaWVfZGltb24uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>"<a href="https://www.flickr.com/photos/jurvetson/8362210873/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Jamie Dimon, CEO of JPMorgan Chase</a>" (<a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY 2.0</a>) by <a href="https://www.flickr.com/people/jurvetson/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">jurvetson</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We wish this were about Jamie Dimon making his <em>SNL</em> debut on Saturday but, alas, we'll settle for some Oscar-worthy corporate conniving. Yesterday, the Commodity Futures Trading Commission announced a mammoth <a href="https://www.axios.com/jp-morgan-spoofing-markets-record-penalty-8a484938-44ef-4690-9c9f-a7d0e015280e.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$920 million settlement</a> with America's largest bank for manipulating markets via "spoofing." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The crime: </strong>Over eight years, JPMorgan traders manipulated prices in global commodities markets by placing tens of thousands of orders for precious metals and Treasuries...only to cancel them later. The bank profited while other traders lost $300+ million.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A trio of government agencies dug into the spoofing allegations, including the DOJ, which used a 1970s-era racketeering and corruption law typically used to pursue the Mafia. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The time: </strong>To understand just how big JPMorgan's penalty is...in the last six years, financial institutions have <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/jpmorgan-paying-920-million-to-resolve-market-manipulation-probes-11601393666?mod=hp_lead_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">collectively paid</a> over $1 billion for spoofing cases. JPMorgan admitted to messing up and, as part of a deferred prosecution, will cooperate with the feds to prove it's cleaning up its act.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we're here: </strong>Bloomberg takes you inside the <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-09-28/inside-the-jpm-precious-metals-desk-called-a-crime-ring-by-prosecutors?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">corporate drama</a> that unraveled the criminal racketeering conspiracy and took down one of JPMorgan's star executives.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/29/2020-retail-bankruptcies-outpace-2008-financial-crisis-aftermath?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Can You Guys Please Stop Biting Me?—The Dust
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Professional services firm BDO released a <a href="https://www.bdo.com/insights/industries/retail-consumer-products/retail-in-the-red-bdo-bi-annual-bankruptcy-upd-(4)?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new report</a> on this year's retail bankruptcies, liquidations, and store closings. Some <span style="text-decoration: line-through;">highlights</span> lowlights: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Through June, </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-retail-bankruptcies-store-closures-hit-record-in-first-half-11601371800?mod=hp_lead_pos2&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">18 retailers</a></span><span> filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection. Most are sellers of apparel, footwear, and home furnishings. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>At this point in the year, we've already surpassed last year's total retail bankruptcies. By the end of 2020, we could even outpace 2010's crush of filings (48). </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>This is yet another example of the Covid-19 pandemic speeding up trends that were chugging along before. E-commerce was changing the retail game before the coronavirus showed up; now e-commerce<em> is</em> the game. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Retail foot traffic is at about 20% of pre-Covid levels, former Morgan Stanley senior retail analyst Walter Loeb </span><span><a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/walterloeb/2020/09/29/retail-bankruptcies-anticipate-massive-layoffs/#c6fb2d3636f0?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">estimates</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>expect more bankruptcies in Q4, though some struggling retailers may ride the holiday season life raft to 2021. But that's also when the bill comes due for 2020 rent deferrals. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+  Not sure how Chapter 7 differs from Chapter 11? </strong>We put together a <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/17/jcpenney-dead-brew-unpacks-bankruptcy?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">guide on all things bankruptcy</a>.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AGRICULTURE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/29/appharvest-will-go-public-1-billion-valuation?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Rare Unicorn Spotted in Appalachia
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="AppHarvest's greenhouse" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNTU3L2FwcGhhcnZlc3Rfc19ncmVlbmhvdXNlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>AppHarvest</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">AppHarvest, a farming startup that grows fruits and veggies in high-tech greenhouses, revealed yesterday it's <a href="https://www.thestreet.com/investing/appharvest-plans-nasdaq-ipo-through-novus-capital-spac-deal?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">going public</a> at a valuation of $1 billion. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In some ways, AppHarvest is <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/29/business/dealbook/coinbase-social-activism.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">conforming</a> to all the 2020 startup trends:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It's going public via a blank-check company, aka a SPAC.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It doesn't generate any revenue yet.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Its name is two unrelated words smashed together. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">In other ways, AppHarvest is unique.</strong> For instance, it's based in Morehead, KY, which is at least three plane flights away from Silicon Valley and in one of the poorest congressional districts, <a href="https://www.axios.com/appharvest-is-going-public-d1cb44d4-30eb-4646-8676-c0645b13db73.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per Axios</a>.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Investors include former AOL CEO Steve Case's Rise of the Rest Seed Fund, which invests in startups outside of the traditional hotspots, and J.D. Vance, author of </span><span><em>Hillbilly Elegy.</em></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>AppHarvest isn't just going public for the Brew story. It needs to raise cash to follow through on its ambitious plans, like building the world's largest greenhouse later this year.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Writing advice: </strong>In her <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/29/morning-brew-style-blog-no-6-purge-clichs-vocabulary?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">latest style blog</a>, Brew editing superstar Eliza Carter tackles clichés and begs the question of why they’re low-hanging fruit that you should avoid like the plague or else you’ll be up a creek without a paddle at the end of the day. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/29/morning-brew-style-blog-no-6-purge-clichs-vocabulary?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Read it</a> and instantly level up your writing. </p>

width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MzYvcGFsYW50aXJfZXh0ZXJpb3IuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eCory Doctorow / Flickr\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe eye of Sauron will turn toward Lower Manhattan today as Palantir \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/what-palantir-does-direct-listing-202144724.html?guccounter=1\u0026guce_referrer=aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZ29vZ2xlLmNvbS8\u0026guce_referrer_sig=AQAAAGdklgUr1xGVrQfvZsX1mKwFl265rxp6zGbkCkdO8oR6AeI8Um8uuGWBG-DbOA9IErTJgHolb8-xkz3yV_QN4Uo74CkTSGr0fvnPBLizKc818MrMRqKehWVBdnSIY6OyfWIpFvDRMvPFZMPJAiJwHhPf7po545u-dbmapXo8XkA8\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egoes public\u003c/a\u003e on the NYSE. It’s expected to be valued at around $22 billion, the WSJ reported last week.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s Palantir?\u003c/strong\u003e Either a software company that works with government agencies or a defense contractor in Allbirds, depending on how you look at it. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePalantir guzzles up surveillance data on things like troop movements, IED attacks, and Covid-19 cases and presents it to users in a super-slick interface. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThose users are almost all government employees at agencies such as the NSA, the CIA, and the Department of Health and Human Services. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCofounder and CEO Alex Karp says he’s not like other tech founders—he’s \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2020/08/20/palantir-denver-hq-ipo-direct-listing/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebeen critical\u003c/a\u003e of what he calls a liberal “monoculture” in Silicon Valley...so he left. Palantir moved from Palo Alto to Denver last month. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe bull case: \u003c/strong\u003ePalantir found its spot in the government contract biz by way of a marketing strategy that is no less creative for the feathers it ruffled: offering free services to soldiers, then letting word travel up the chain of command. It keeps those contracts flowing with close ties to the Trump administration via cofounder and famed venture capitalist Peter Thiel.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe bear case: \u003c/strong\u003ePalantir is 17 years old and still isn’t profitable. Plus, it’s reportedly \u003ca href=\"https://nymag.com/intelligencer/2020/09/inside-palantir-technologies-peter-thiel-alex-karp.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elosing favor\u003c/a\u003e in the intelligence and national security communities, and its plans to branch out into police and private-sector partnerships have mostly flopped. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWe may be in for some chaos \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBoth Palantir and workplace management tool Asana are \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/palantirs-and-asanas-dueling-ipos-to-test-direct-listing-process-nyse-11601402163?mod=hp_lead_pos4\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elisting directly\u003c/a\u003e on the NYSE today, meaning they won’t actually raise money from going public. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBecause they cut out investment banks’ underwriting fees, direct listings are an increasingly popular method. Spotify hit the markets via direct listing back in 2018, and Slack did the same last year. The option has its benefits, but can cause volatility since it takes a while to settle on a price.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast night, President Trump and former VP Joe Biden squared off in the \u003ca href=\"https://apps.npr.org/liveblogs/20200929-debate/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efirst presidential debate\u003c/a\u003e, a pared-down event with a mini audience, no handshakes, and countless interruptions from the president. It was chaotic. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat they said (about business)\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCovid-19: \u003c/strong\u003eTrump claimed the U.S. is “weeks away from a vaccine” and pharma companies could move faster, but politics are slowing things down. Biden accused Trump of going against the scientists in his administration who have laid out a longer timeline. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRecovery: \u003c/strong\u003e“You can’t fix the economy until you fix the Covid crisis,” Biden said, adding that Trump is not taking appropriate measures to stop the outbreak. Biden also expressed concerns about a “K-shaped” recovery in which top earners recover while working-class families are left behind.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTaxes: \u003c/strong\u003eUnder Biden’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/09/joe-biden-releases-first-part-economic-agenda?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eeconomic plan\u003c/a\u003e, Trump argued higher corporate taxes would push businesses to leave the country, causing “a depression of the likes you’ve never seen.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eOn personal taxes...following the bombshell \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/27/nyt-releases-explosive-report-president-trumps-tax-history?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNYT report\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e on Trump’s tax returns, Biden and his running mate Kamala Harris \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/09/29/918281941/biden-harris-release-2019-tax-returns-hours-before-the-first-debate?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereleased their 2019 tax returns\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e hours before the debate. Biden and his wife, Jill, paid close to $300,000 in federal taxes on $945,000 in taxable income last year. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp Dimon making his \u003cem\u003eSNL\u003c/em\u003e debut on Saturday but, alas, we'll settle for some Oscar-worthy corporate conniving. Yesterday, the Commodity Futures Trading Commission announced a mammoth \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/jp-morgan-spoofing-markets-record-penalty-8a484938-44ef-4690-9c9f-a7d0e015280e.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$920 million settlement\u003c/a\u003e with America's largest bank for manipulating markets via \"spoofing.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe crime: \u003c/strong\u003eOver eight years, JPMorgan traders manipulated prices in global commodities markets by placing tens of thousands of orders for precious metals and Treasuries...only to cancel them later. The bank profited while other traders lost $300+ million.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA trio of government agencies dug into the spoofing allegations, including the DOJ, which used a 1970s-era racketeering and corruption law typically used to pursue the Mafia. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe time: \u003c/strong\u003eTo understand just how big JPMorgan's penalty is...in the last six years, financial institutions have \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/jpmorgan-paying-920-million-to-resolve-market-manipulation-probes-11601393666?mod=hp_lead_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecollectively paid\u003c/a\u003e over $1 billion for spoofing cases. JPMorgan admitted to messing up and, as part of a deferred prosecution, will cooperate with the feds to prove it's cleaning up its act.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we're here: \u003c/strong\u003eBloomberg takes you inside the \u003ca href=\"https://www.bdo.com/insights/industries/retail-consumer-products/retail-in-the-red-bdo-bi-annual-bankruptcy-upd-(4)?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew report\u003c/a\u003e on this year's retail bankruptcies, liquidations, and store closings. Some \u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: line-through;\"\u003ehighlights\u003c/span\u003e lowlights: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThrough June, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-retail-bankruptcies-store-closures-hit-record-in-first-half-11601371800?mod=hp_lead_pos2\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e18 retailers\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection. Most are sellers of apparel, footwear, and home furnishings. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAt this point in the year, we've already surpassed last year's total retail bankruptcies. By the end of 2020, we could even outpace 2010's crush of filings (48). \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThis is yet another example of the Covid-19 pandemic speeding up trends that were chugging along before. E-commerce was changing the retail game before the coronavirus showed up; now e-commerce\u003cem\u003e is\u003c/em\u003e the game. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eRetail foot traffic is at about 20% of pre-Covid levels, former Morgan Stanley senior retail analyst Walter Loeb \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/walterloeb/2020/09/29/retail-bankruptcies-anticipate-massive-layoffs/#c6fb2d3636f0?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eestimates\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eexpect more bankruptcies in Q4, though some struggling retailers may ride the holiday season life raft to 2021. But that's also when the bill comes due for 2020 rent deferrals. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+  Not
